column4: Having problems with Nvidia drivers 180.29. Installed them, they worked GREAT. Did a system update, including kernel, and now when I try to reinstall them it causes lots of problems... any suggestions on how to wipe all the configs and start over with a fresh Nvidia install?
what happens when you try to reinstall?
when I try to reinstall, upon reboot I get a window telling me errors and X server won't start properly
and are you reinstalling the drivers from a TTY with the gui stopped?
yes I am
when I reinstall from TTY it also gives me errors stating that drivers were installed another way and it will TRY to remove them as best as it can

that's weird.. I've done that several times with no issues.. there is a way to uninstall the nvidia binary driver then try to reinstall again.. also make sure that all nvidia references in synaptic are NOT installed.

Zzeiss... VESA drivers don't run 3D acceleration. So no games. Also I have had NO problems running NVidia drivers and can run them now if I want to go with 177... but I want some of the new improvements from 180.29... thanks for your concern though...
ok I guess I will just keep trying or go back to 177 drivers :( Thanks
I had to uninstall 173 & 177 drivers from the system before installing the binary blob from nvidia.. otherwise I ended up with similar issues..
AH... I will try that then/ Thanks scunizi
also nvidia-settings needs to go
ok thanks scunizi
mark for complete removal correct?
